creator: SpotForMakers
title: DIY Google Home With Bluetooth Speaker on Raspberry Pi Zero Docking Hub
description: This project outlines the steps to build a DIY Google Home device using a Raspberry Pi Zero W, a MakerSpot's Raspberry Pi Zero Docking Hub, and a Bluetooth speaker. The project involves installing and setting up Google Assistant and a wake word engine on the Raspberry Pi.
steps: Prepare the SD card with the latest Raspbian OS (Stretch) using Etcher.

Install the Pi Zero W on the Raspberry Pi Zero Docking Hub, insert the prepared SD card, and connect a monitor, USB keyboard, USB mouse, and microphone. Power up the device using the power port on the docking hub.
Configure WiFi, disable HDMI/Analog Audio in /boot/config.txt, enable SSH/VNC (optional), and reboot the Pi.
Pair the Raspberry Pi with your Bluetooth speaker.
Modify the .asoundrc file to setup the built-in microphone on the docking hub and save a copy to /etc/asound.conf, preventing it from being overwritten.
Prepare Google Project and Account by following the provided link.
Setup virtual environment and install prerequisite libraries and Google Assistant SDK.
Install Snowboy Wake Word Engine to enable the "OK Google" wake word.
Test the Google Assistant and optionally configure the Pi to auto-connect to the Bluetooth speaker and run the Google Assistant software headless via SSH.
